childMarkdownRemark.html:
Oh.. its not actually magic...

Alright, made it to the third activity (zero based counting folks!). Here is where we're going to start getting our app to talk to the contentful API. When I first did this exercise, I was boggled on how we knew that contentful was compatable with gatsby, I spent forever on contentfuls website. Turns out I needed to be looking on gatsbys site.

Just from looking at the documentation I found sourceing from headless CMS and within there it's got the documentation for linking up to contentful. Now within here it instructs on running the npm gatsby-source-contentful .

Then also, if I wanted to make my project incorperate other data sources, its got a whole list of other data source implmentations! No longer just a magic black box concept to me! Sometime in the near future, I need to pick a data source that is not Contentful, and read my way through that documentation so really get whats happening.

... shit

Alright.. I sort of ran into a problem. And I'm not at the point where I'm entirely sure what has happened. I'm either not figuring out what's going wrong with the configuration of the app, OR - I'm getting mad at a fish for not being able to run.

I had a series of errors, and it seemed like I was working my way through them systematically:

  1. When I added the gatsby-source-contentful plugin to the gatsby-config file, it seemed like the app would not be able to find the assets in the file system that were there already. Gatsby totes that it can take source data from multiple sources at once and mash them together, so I'm not sure why adding this plugin would have any bearing on the compile whatsoever. I thought maybe it was because of the order that I listed the plugins, so I reconfigured that a little, and I never really got rid of the error. I noted that the lesson moves on to change the gatsby-node.js and the blog-post.js.. I figured that maybe my error would be fixed if i updated those files to match the tutorials.
  2. In my infinate wisdome to simply copy the gatsby-node.js, and the blog-post.js files from the activity-2 tutorial, I was able to move past the error messages I was receiving,(about time) but graduated to an even more problematic error message. Type Error: Cannot Read property title of undefined. What.. the.. hell. This is where I scoured the interwebs for someone.. anyone with this error, appearently its the programing equivelent of just saying you have IBS - no real diagnosus, but its something.

So.. what did I do.. well while searching for the answers to my above issues, I found that there was an actual contentful gatsby starter project.. I started a new project and followed the documentation for that, and got a really slick site up and running in about 5 min.

I might abondon this branch and start a new project using this starter - and pickup where I left off with the activites.

... more to come.
